lines.text: [last lines]
you can bury freedom but you can't kill it. Taylor Jackson died for freedom. Aunt Lucille had to kill to get it. Life and death are only temporary but freedom goes on forever.
I'm the kind of girl who can resist anything but temptation.
There are a lot of ways you can kill a person. There are fast ways, and there are slow ways. Chester was killin' me the slow way for thirteen years.
Life and death are only temporary, but freedom goes on forever.
Uncle Dove, do you really think Aunt Lucille stole that car?
Absolutely. Baby sister wants a car, she's gonna get one!
You could drive by today and never know there was a pool there at all but I know the secret. There's water trapped underneath all that cement, three inches of water as blue as Lucille's eyes.
You're wanted on the set.
Honey, I'm wanted in seven states.
You're trespassing on public property!
That's four dozen pimento cheese sandwiches gone entirely to waste!

[as Lucille heads to the Golden Gate bridge to rid herself of Chester forever]
C'mon, Lucille! You can't do this! You need me!

[quietly]
That was true once, but not anymore.

[Norman suddenly drives up as Lucille leaves a party]
Norman, did you follow me to that party?

[smiling]
Oh, yes, ma'am.
He said no, when he should've said yes. Mama, I killed him, cut his head off.
Can I leave my husband here?
Sure.
I hope she's living it up because if they catch her, that's when the fun stops.
Would you happen to know how your slingshot wound up in my car?
I figured you could probably use some protection.

[from trailer]
What does Chester say about all this?

[impersonating Chester]
Keep dreaming, Lucille, you're not going anywhere.
